title: Potato and Parsnip Hash
directions: Heat the oven to 375°F. To prepare the tomato confit, quarter the tomatoes. Remove the cores and the seeds, then place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with some olive oil. Sprinkle with thyme and the garlic. Place the tomatoes in the oven and bake for about 10 to 15 minutes, or until the skin is slightly crispy and then tomatoes are aromatic.
Grate the parsnips and potatoes on a box grater. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the scallion. Squeeze out any liquid and transfer to a new bowl. Stir in the olive oil and thyme.
Heat your waffle maker to high and spray with oil. Divide the potato mixture in two, and place in the waffle maker. Cook until the potatoes are crisp, 8 to 10 minutes (depending on your waffle iron).
Place the avocados in a food processor along with the lime juice, olive oil, cilantro, and salt, and purée until smooth.
To serve, place a potato waffle on a plate and top with a few tomato petals and the poached egg. Drizzle with the avocado purée and the creme fraiche. Finish with micro greens, salt, and pepper.
ingredients: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 scallion, white part only, thinly sliced
2 avocados, halved, seeded, and skins removed
